titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the St. Philip's Episcopal Church records, 1878-2002 RL.11847

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-05-20 13:48:23 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: St. Philip's Episcopal Church was founded in 1878 in Durham, N.C. This collections contains vestry minutes, correspondence, minutes from various organizations within the church, rector's notes, church bulletins and programs, slides, photographs, financial records, appointment books, scrapbooks, clippings, canvass reports, auditor's reports, sermons, and printed materials. Also included are the records, notes, and correspondence related to parish historian Harold Parker's history of the church (published in 1997), as well as a complete file of the church's extant sermons (1912-1994) Parker compiled for another book. There are also five reels of microfilm containing copies of vestry minutes, marriage records, a church register, etc., organized by Mr. Parker into roughly chronological order and divided into sections by rectorship.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: St. Philip's Episcopal Church was founded in 1878 in Durham, N.C.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The St. Philip's Episcopal Church records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a deposit between 1993 and 2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], St. Philip's Episcopal Church Records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Unprocessed inventory uploaded by Laurin Penland, May 2020

This collection guide was created or updated with information provided by donors or external parties, and box or file lists have not been verified by Rubenstein Library staff. Errors may be present and can be reported to special-collections@duke.edu.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Harold T. Parker was a professor at Duke University, and his papers are part of Duke University Archives: https://find.library.duke.edu/catalog/DUKE003078946
The Rubenstein also holds the papers of Elizabeth Roberts, who was a member of St. Philip's Episcopal Church: https://find.library.duke.edu/catalog/DUKE001801221
Other items relating to St. Philip's have been individually cataloged and can be found by searching the catalog for "St. Philip's Episcopal Church".

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collections contains vestry minutes, correspondence, minutes from various organizations within the church, rector's notes, church bulletins and programs, slides, photographs, financial records, appointment books, scrapbooks, clippings, canvass reports, auditor's reports, sermons, and printed materials. Also included are the records, notes, and correspondence related to parish historian Harold Parker's history of the church (published in 1997), as well as a complete file of the church's extant sermons (1912-1994) Parker compiled for another book. There are also five reels of microfilm containing copies of vestry minutes, marriage records, a church register, etc., organized by Mr. Parker into roughly chronological order and divided into sections by rectorship.

The History of St. Philip's Episcopal Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A complete file of the extant sermons (1912-1994) collected by Harold Parker, Parish Historian, who compiled the sermons for a book entitled "Sermons from St. Philip's." Also included is corresondence relating to the book and Parker's notes about the sermons. The bulk of the extant sermons consist of 120 sermons written by L. Bartine Sherman (rector 1957-1967).

did.unittitle: Sermons and correspondence collected by Harold Parker
Sermons and correspondence collected by Harold Parker
Rectorship of Clarence R. Hader, Jr.
Rectorship of C. Thomas Midyette, III
Marriage register and communion register microfilm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This addition further documents church thinking, and also its activities when preparing and publishing a church history. There is an unbound version of St. Philip's published book of seventy sermons as well as the sermons rejected for the book; writing/sermons by Sidney Stuart Bost and others; correspondence, notes and more items related to the preparation of "The History of St. Philip's;" correspondence, photographs, and other items concerning Rev. Midyette's rectorship; and additional sermons.

did.unittitle: Materials for creating "Sermons from St. Philip's" and "The History of St. Philip's"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Addition contains primarily typescript manuscripts and various edited page proofs for Harold T. Parker's "Sermons from St. Philip's." Also includes correspondence regarding the publication of the book and a typescript manuscript, "Chronologies: Harold T. Parker--An Atom in Chaos," that details his life in relation to selected world events.

did.unittitle: Typescripts and correspondence regarding writing projects of Harold Parker
